definition: to be promoted to
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Allow me to convey my congratulations on your promotion to Minister of Trade.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我向您升任贸易部长表示祝贺。

sentences.english: John was pipped at the post by Adams for promotion to manager.
sentences.chinese: 在升任经理的竞争中，约翰以些微差距输给亚当。

sentences.english: He would eventually ascend to Chief of Cryptography for the New Republic.
sentences.chinese: 他最终升任新共和国密码组组长。

sentences.english: Brown is being kicked upstairs to become chairman of the new company.
sentences.chinese: 布朗表面是升任新公司的董事长，其实是明升暗降。

definition: to transfer/to move to another post
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to hold an office or post
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
post/position/job/duties
to appoint
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
successor/(attributive) future
promote/promotion
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
office/duty
